text: Gaetano Martoriello (c. 1680–1733)De Dominici states he died in 1723 after enjoying to much gaming and women. was an Italian painter of the late-Baroque period, active in his natal city of Naples. He painted mainly marine vedute and landscapes. He initially trained under Giacomo del Po, but desiring to paint landscapes he worked under Nicola Massaro, who claimed to have trained under Salvatore Rosa. He is also said to have worked under Francesco Solimena, after the later painter rebuked Martoriello for criticizing some paintings by the German landscape artist, Francesco Joachim Beich. De Dominici, page 366. ==References== ==External links== Category:1733 deaths Category:17th-century Neapolitan people Category:17th-century Italian painters Category:Italian male painters Category:18th-century Italian painters Category:Italian landscape painters Category:Neapolitan painters Category:Italian Baroque painters Category:Year of birth uncertain Category:18th-century Neapolitan people
title: Gaetano Martoriello
